Class Rhombus

  • java.lang.Object
    • ShapeBaseClass
      • TwoDimensionalShapes
        • Rhombus

  • public class Rhombus
extends TwoDimensionalShapes
    The Rhombus class extends the TwoDimensionalShapes. The fields that are specific to this Rhombus class sides, perimeter, and area. The methods that are specific to this class is the setters and getters for the instance fields, calculateArea function, and calculatePerimeter function which the area the perimeter respectively given sides.

      • Rhombus

        public Rhombus(java.lang.String name,
               int dimX,
               int dimY)
        Constructor with the argument name of the rhombus and the dimensions as its parameter. It calls the super class constructor(TwoDimensionalShapes). It also calculates the sides, the surface area, and the perimeter and set them to the instance variables respectively
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the circle
        dimX - the dimensions of the rhombus
        dimY - the radius of the circle
